inn1.comm: Jarvis lands a little short of a length first up, and Charles nudges a single down to fine leg off the hip. Not a lot of movement, and it looks a slow track.
A better length from Jarvis, fuller and straighter and Powell is struck him on the knee-roll.
There's some shape for the bowler, back in through the air to the left-hander. It's met with solid defense.
Well bowled. Nicely straight, and Powell defends. Jarvis is feeling his way into this spell, and this delivery is bowled at 128kph.
Another probing length delivery from Jarvis, this one at 130kph. Powell defends

Runs this time! Too short from Jarvis, and Powell swivels to pull the ball powerfully out into the deep square leg region ... Mpofu races round from fine leg, but a slightly uneven outfield gets the better of him and the ball bounces past him. It wasn't the most athletic effort ...
Cracked to cover, but straight to the fielder. Dot ball to start from the player they call "Mr. Dots".
looped up nice and high from Utseya, the ball hanging on the breeze and Charles defending.
Yet more defense from the doughty right-hander.
And another one. Utseya is stringing dot balls together very well.
Too wide from Utseya, and a sliced cut runs down to third man.
Fired fast and flat down the leg side.
And a good finish to a solid first over. Dot ball.
Appeal for lbw! That pitched in line and swung back in to beat Powell's defensive push ... but it's struck him a little too high and it's not out. Good decision from the umpire.
Jarvis offers some width, and Powell stands tall and opens the face to run a single through gully.
this has been a good start from Jarvis. On a length, a hint of wobble, and Charles defends.
full, swinging and this time Charles has a drive. He's not quite to the pitch of it, and an inside edge thuds into his pad.
Yet more defense. These West Indies openers are being very watchful.
quicker and fuller from Jarvis. Was he aiming for the yorker? Charles struck on the foot, but the ball was clearly slipping down leg.
landing quite far outside leg and turning across the left-hander, who presses forward and nudges a single behind square on the leg side.
driven hard down to long on, where there is a fielder in place.
Powell looks for a drop-and-run single to cover, but the fielder is in quickly and there's none to be had.
this time Powell uses his feet, jumping out and driving down to the man at long off.
watchful defense from Charles. He's a hit-or-block sort of player, and at the moment he's blocking.
there's a shot! Charles charges out and bludgeons a drive up and over cover.
chopped down through gully, and they rush through for one.
full and straight, flicked into the leg side but straight at the fielder.
a slower ball from Jarvis! It came out at just 101kph, and Charles drove it to mid-on.
Charles starts shuffling away to leg before the ball is even bowled, but Jarvis follows him with a full, yorker length delivery. Swiped into the leg side.
timing, rather than power from Charles as he flicks into the leg side. He threads the gap in front of square leg, and they take two runs.

big shot! Charles made room and aimed to send this into orbit. He got rather too much underneath it, however, and the ball went very high ... and plugged in the outfield not a yard from the boundary. Not the quickest outfield this, then.
lovely, oldschool flight from Utseya, who draws Powell forward in defense.
shot! Powell skips out, gets to the pitch and smites a mighty blow over wide long on.
flatter from Utseya, and this time Powell defends.

horrid misfield from Ervine! Again Powell charged the bowler, but this time made room and drove through cover. Ervine was out on the boundary and ran round to stop the shot, but lazily put his hand down and the ball bounced past him. Again, not the greatest effort.
left alone outside off.
and solid defense to end the over.
on a length and nicely straight. Pushed into the off side.
another slower ball from Jarvis, but this one is a bouncer. Charles reads it and pulls to leg.
full, straight, and met with an equally straight bat.
was this the offcutter? Bowled at just over 124kph by Jarvis, and it lands full and wide and leaves the left-hander off the pitch. Powell throws himself into a booming drive, and is beaten.
full again, and this time Powell reacts with a more restrained drive. Stopped at cover.

a slower ball gone wrong! Jarvis is trying all sorts of variations in this opening spell, and until now they've worked. This back-of-the-hand slower one slips out as a high full toss, and Powell shellacked it over wide mid-on.
he aims at Charles' middle stump to start, and the right-hander tucks a single to leg.
spanked through cover! A gentle, wide half volley from Mpofu, at 125kph, and it's met with Powell's scything blade. Straight through the gap, and away for four.
again pitched up to the bat, but this time the drive finds mid-off.
another boundary, and West Indies' openers are flying now. Powell seizes on width and a lack of pace and slices a square drive through point.
a better length from Mpofu as he changes the line of the attack, Powell stepping forward but leaving the ball alone outside off.
chopped down to third man to end the over.

and Jarvis almost provides! He beats Powell's outside edge with a lovely delivery, the best of the day so far. The line meant the left-hander had to play, but the movement meant he couldn't get anything on it.
a little wider from Jarvis, and Powell leaves this one alone.
on a length and straight, with a hint of curve back in towards the bat. Powell puts his right foot forward and defends.
Jarvis' line strays a little towards leg stump, but he's not punished as Powell is hit on the thigh.
on a length, and leaving the left-hander at 127kph. Powell has a look, and shoulders arms.
Jarvis ends a superb over with another pinpoint delivery, on a length and in the channel on off stump. Powell defends, and that's a maiden.

this outfield must be really soggy after the overnight rain. Charles meets the first delivery of Mpofu's second over with a mighty heave to midwicket ... where the ball again plugs in the outfield. That looked like a certain boundary. It landed about a metre away from the rope.
a nicely-timed push into the off side results in a single.
chopped down through gully for one more.
Mpofu has been all over the place, and this is an atrocious delivery. A gentle leg-stump half-volley at 120kph, with fine leg up in the circle, and he's easily flicked for four.

that's more like it! This time Mpofu bends his back, landing the ball on a great length and at a good pace too - 133kph - to find Charles' outside edge. There's no slip in place, and the ball is stopped at third man.
Mpofu comes round the wicket to Powell, who punches into the leg side.
he hits a shortish length outside off to start, Powell standing tall to work the ball to cover.
fuller and wider from Chibhabha, Powell stepping forward but leaving alone. Taylor, who is up to the stumps, likes that one.
now a single comes, Powell using the bottom hand to flick to leg.
Charles leans forward to drive, and does so without much timing.
a little more timing in this stroke, and better placement too. A single is taken.
an offcutter lands on leg stump, but is nudged straight to the fielder to end the over.
wrong line from the bowler, too far outside leg, and Powell nudges him into the leg side for runs.
tucked to leg for a single
tip-and-run to cover
a huge hit to end the over! Flighted up outside off by Utseya, and Charles bends into a slog sweep that sends the ball arcing high over long on.
poor line from Chibhabha, and much too short. He doesn't have the pace to trouble Powell, who pulls down to fine leg for four.
run down to third man to follow up
driven through cover, another one to the total.
but a good length delivery to end the over with a dot ball.
defended into the off side
driven back to the bowler, who fields cleanly.
turned with the spin to square leg for a single.
Powell uses his feet, and drives down to long on.
flicked through midwicket for a single.
Powell gets back and across to drive back to the bowler.
some turn straight away! Pitched on leg, spinning towards middle. Charles defends.
there's some excitement as Charles gets well forward to sweep, but he gets bat on it to send the ball down to fine leg.
another sweep, and more runs to be had.
Powell's feet don't move an inch but he gets a good connection to drive to long off.
sliced in the air, but safely! Charles was aiming to lift him down the ground, but drift and spin took the ball towards the outer half of his bat. Fortunately for him, the ball landed safely.
superb delivery to end! Drift, grip and spin, and both batsman and keeper are beaten. That spun miles.
driven hard, but straight back to the bowler.
dropped! Well, good effort from Sibanda, but he can't hold on. Charles struck the ball firmly towards midwicket, where the fielder leapt and got a hand to it, but the chance went down.
punched to cover for one.
spinning down the leg side, turned away for a single by Charles.

confusion in the running! Powell tapped the ball towards cover and looked for a single, there was some hesitation and Chibhabha came charging in ... Eventually the batsmen set off for a run, and the fielder's shy went wide at the non-striker's end. That was mighty close.
glanced to fine leg to end the over.
Powell begins the over by shimmying down the track and aiming to launch Mushangwe over midwicket, but he's beaten in the flight and struck on the pad.
nicely bowled once again, and Powell defends.
swept hard out to midwicket, where there is cover.
driven straight to the man at cover.
punched down to long off, and they ease through for a single.
a little too straight from Mushangwe, and Powell places him through square leg.
good start, straight and on a length. Defended.
more defense from Powell.
pitched up to Powell, who smashes the ball back down the track, almost taking out his batting partner.
too straight from Masakadza, and there's a run to be had to fine leg.
pushed through cover for a quick single.
driven straight back to the bowler, who fields cleanly. A tidy first over of medium pace from Masakadza.
driven back to the bowler.
he's got a googly! This one comes out of the back of the hand, and isn't picked by Powell, who is beaten.
turned to square leg, where there is a fielder in place.
flicked with the spin towards midwicket this time, where the fielder makes a tumbling stop.
fifty for Powell! He gets there with a lofted drive over extra cover, the ball plugging in the outfield once again.
a slog sweep from Charles, but it's not the greatest connection.
Charles comes down the track, but is beaten by the lack of pace from Masakadza and struck on the pad. "Well bowled Hammy," says Taylor.
beaten on the cut! Was that the legcutter? A hint of extra bounce too.
and another! This one was definitely a legcutter, and it grips and turns past the bat.
poor delivery to follow that up though! He'd done so well, but gives it away with a gentle leg-stump delivery that is easily glanced for four. Fine leg was up in the circle and never had a chance.
flicked into the leg side, and a single is taken.
turned to leg to end the over.
Mushangwe continues, and Powell steps back to trash a cut to point.
Powell looks like he wants to get a move on after the drinks break. Again he's on the back foot and this time pulls to midwicket.
pushed to cover point by Charles, and the fielders swoop in ... but there's a collision! It's very minor, and Sibanda limps for a few moments, but he's fine.
spinning in, but from too wide outside off. Powell opens the blade and runs it down to third man.
Charles sweeps, but the ball dips under the bat and he's hit on the pad. He's struck well outside off, and there is no appeal.
chopped down to backward point, where the fielder stops it cleanly.
wide, very wide to start outside off. If Powell had left that alone it would've been an extra, but he carves out to deep cover for a single.
this is a much better ball, and Charles can't get it away.
again Charles looks to thread the gap on the leg side, but he finds midwicket.

Charles sets himself for a sweep, having racked up a couple of dot balls, but he can't execute it. Has that come off the bat or the pad? Either way, they take a single. The ball looped up and over Taylor, and fine leg rushed in.

heaved into the leg side! That went really high, and there were two men out in the deep trying to get themselves into position to take the catch. Fortunately for Powell, the ball fell safely between them.
turned in front of square for a single to end the over.
punched firmly off the back foot, and through the gap at cover. All of the outfielders are on the leg side, and that's four.
a better line from Mushangwe, and Powell can't get this one away.
Powell glides the ball to short third man for a single.
Charles misses with the flick, and is struck on the pad. He's just one away from the fifty, but there's no single to be had.
there it is! A fifty for Johnson Charles. He sweeps to short fine leg, where the fielder dives but can't stop the single.
played with the spin into the leg side.
Masakadza continues to plug away on a length outside off stump. Charles can't get it away.
poor line, drifting down the leg side and with fine leg up in the circle that's free runs.
four more! This time Charles makes room and smokes a lofted drive through extra cover.
chopped down towards point, where the ball is stopped.
third man is also up in the circle, and Charles was looking to run this one past him. It's the legcutter, though, and he can't lay bat on it.
another boundary! Masakadza is leaking runs here. Charles sweeps and the ball pings out of the middle.
driven hard out to long off.
a filthy long hop outside off gets what it deserves: Charles cuts and the ball races to the cover point boundary.
and another! Waller isn't bowling to his field, or any field Taylor could set, for that matter. Another short, wide delivery is spanked to the boundary.
that's better. Fuller, and straighter, and it's driven back to the bowler.
Charles leans forward to thread a drive through cover. Just the single this time.
Powell guides the ball to short third man off the face of the bat, and asks for a single, but there's none to be had as the ball goes straight to the fielder.
just over the fielder! Powell lofted down the ground, and Chibhabha on the boundary leapt up but it was just over him.
Powell advances down the pitch to Mushangwe, but the bowler spots him and adjusts his length.
driven down to long on for a single.
Charles sweeps this time, but the stroke finds the fielder at short fine leg.
shot! Charles makes room and Mushangwe attempts to follow him, but lands a half volley in front of the batsman, who lifts it down the ground for four more. Zimbabwe are unraveling just a little.

flicked to square leg. The fielder hurls a shy at Mushangwe, who can't stop it cleanly and is left holding his hand after taking a stinging blow to the finger. Worse still, the misfield means there are overthrows to be had.
again turned into the leg side.
Charles pulls, but he's early in the stroke and the ball goes in the air in front of square, landing in front of midwicket.
short once again, but a little quicker this time and Charles' pull is a little hurried.

a wicket, against the run of play! Mpofu slung down another short one, and Powell stepped back and across to pull without bothering to keep the ball down. Ervine was out at deep square leg, and he held onto a simple catch. There's barely any celebration from Mpofu, who clearly isn't having the best day.
a slower cutter is driven towards mid-on.
and Charles gets half forward to stroke the ball into the covers, where it's stopped by a fielder.
similarly to Masakadza, when he settles into a wicket-to-wicket line he can be hard to get away. This is driven, but finds the field.
a slow cutter is met with the full face of the bat.
defended by Bravo.
a slower ball slips out as a high full toss, with Bravo clubs into the leg side.

shot! That's a marvelous, imperious stroke. Chibhabha offered a throwdown delivery, a long half-volley, and Charles just eased it over wide long off for six. Didn't overhit it, just timed it supremely.
nurdled to leg for a single to keep the strike. Charles just eight away from the ton now.
Mpofu continues, and slings a wide down the leg side to begin.
this one is a little straighter, but is still heading towards the leg side and Charles works it in that direction, but find the field.
a gentle short delivery, a meaty pull, and a misfield. We've seen that combination more than once today. Charles moves to within one stroke of the century with a pulled four.
Mpofu's lines have gone completely awry. Again he spears this down the leg side, but fortunately for the bowler it clips the pad - otherwise it would have been a wide.
full and straight, this time Charles does find the gap on the leg side and a single results.
just a hint of width offered outside off, and Bravo glides a single through gully.
the point fielder gets a hand on a cut, taking some of the power out of it and stopping a boundary.
a century for Johnson Charles! He chips a slow, looping delivery from Maskadza down the ground, and rushes back for the second.
driven down to long on for a single.
Bravo looks to push a quicker, length delivery through point but he can't find the space for a single.
this time he does find the gap, and they sprint through.
punched firmly, but straight to the fielder.
and the over ends with another boundary! Charles makes room to the hapless Masakadza, and slams a drive through the motionless cover field. Cruising.
an offcutter from Mpofu takes the inner half of the bat, bobbling off the pad.
this one is wider, inviting a shot, and Charles guides a single to third man.

if you'd have asked Bravo what his ideal delivery to face is, this would probably be it. Very full, and quite wide outside off, from around the wicket. Bravo clears the front leg and slams a good-looking drive over extra cover. Flat and hard.
Mpofu re-adjusts his length, and this time the shot isn't on for Bravo.

close! Bravo tapped the ball towards Sibanda at backward point and the batsmen set off. Charles sprinted hard and put in the dive once he got close, but had Sibanda's throw hit he would have been out.
looped up high, Bravo pushes back to the bowler.
a little flatter through the air this time, and Bravo works it watchfully to leg.
well bowled once again. Mushangwe's strength, it would appear, is his control. He offers Bravo nothing to hit.
pitching and spinning in, Bravo defends.
this lands a little wider, but turns in and Bravo can't get the shot away.
this is what Zimbabwe need. Mushangwe lands another one on a good length, and Bravo defends to complete the maiden.
an offcutter starts on middle and heads towards leg, and is flicked down to fine leg.
just short of a good length and rising off the pitch, having been bowled at 125.9kph, and Bravo stands tall to punch to point.
a slower one from Mpofu, from round the wicket, and Bravo reads it - just about - to defend back down the track.
quicker this time, and a touch wider, but Bravo's watchful stroke is stopped at point.
pitching on a length, from around the wicket, and seaming in to the left-hander, who nudges to leg off the splice. No run to be had.
a good delivery to end with, aimed right at the top of off and Bravo can only defend.
he starts with a wrong 'un that is bowled flat and fast, but down the leg side.
Charles slogs to midwicket, and gets this one right out of the middle! Mushangwe bowled this one much slower through the air, and Charles got down really low to slog-sweep. He hit that fiercely hard.
another firm sweep, but this one isn't airborne and a single is the result.
monstrous! Bravo has been muted, until now. He skips down to Mushangwe and sends the ball arcing straight back over the bowler's head, gunbarrel straight.
close once again! There's been a little bit of indifferent running from the West Indies, but they are safely through for a single.
punched to leg, and another single
a good finish for Mushangwe, but the damage has been done in this over.
taken on the full and driven very hard down to long on.
Bravo steps back and away to make room, but his cut is stopped at cover point.
close again! Bravo cut in the air this time, and the ball curled towards Waller at cover point. He was in two minds as to whether to go for the catch or stop the shot, and in the end he did neither.
eased out into the deep on the leg side, where the field is spread.
much too short from Utseya, and Bravo has plenty of time to rock back and pick the gap at extra cover with a firm backfoot punch. All of Utseya's protection is on the leg side, so that's four.
Bravo stays deep in his crease to work this one away and keep the strike.
Jarvis starts with a full toss that is clubbed down to the fielder at long off.

again Jarvis strains for the yorker, and it's a full toss but it's low and swinging in towards Charles, who was looking to paddle the ball to leg, and is hit on the back foot. There's an emotive, pleading appeal and he's given! Charles looks like he's going to walk off, but Bravo suggests he asks for a review ... and that's good advice! Replays show the ball would have missed leg, and so the umpire's decision is reversed.
rising off a length, and Charles stands tall to aim a slap-cut into the covers. A loose-wristed, slightly wild shot.
Charles stays deep in his crease and bunts a full ball down the ground for a single.

very full and swinging, Bravo makes room and takes it on the full, right out of the middle of the bat ... but the shot finds Utseya, who just about stops it - and does well to save what would have been a boundary.
a slower ball, and it's an offcutter. Bravo stands up to guide it to gully.

a wild heave from Bravo, and he's much to early into the shot as it's a slower ball from Mpofu. There's a noise as ball passes bat, but it was delivered so slowly that it bounces well in front of Taylor.

well, Taylor has a man out on the cover boundary for Mpofu, but he could do nothing about this. Mpofu was aiming to slip a wide yorker under the bat, but Bravo stayed deep in his crease to smoke a drive past extra cover. The man in the deep charged round, but couldn't get to it.
this is good from Bravo. Having scored the boundary, he rotates the strike with a single.
dispatched! It was another cutter from Mpofu, and Charles fetched it from outside off with a massive hoick across the line.

even further! Charles back right away to leg and Mpofu tried to follow him, but the batsman went through with the stroke in majestic style, picking up a half-volley and lifting it well over the wide long on boundary. Johnson is on the charge!
gone this time! Finally Mpofu gets the yorker right, and he's rewarded immediately. Full, straight and swinging in. Charles plays over top of it, and his stumps are rattled.
good start to the over from Jarvis, zoning in on Bravo's feet with a yorker.

oh dear. Well, he started with a good delivery, but the follow-up is utterly horrid. He loses all control, sending down a beamer outside off that Bravo flays to the cover boundary. It was unintended, and Jarvis is quick to tell the batsman so.

Andre Russell's almost been cut in half! Jarvis offered up another full toss, this time a low one, and Bravo sent it scorching back down the ground, straight at the non-striker. Russell had to take evasive action, lest he be eviscerated!
a slower ball, and it's the offcutter. It's a little short, but Bravo picks it and swivels to pull out to midwicket.
Russell heaves across the line to pick up a single down to long on.
another slower ball to Bravo, and again he does well to pick it - but can't really punish the bowler. Just the single.
another low, swinging full toss ends the over. That isn't actually a bad delivery to bowl at this stage, and Russell can't get underneath it. Driven down to long on.
there's an appeal straight away as Russell makes a hash of an attempted sweep, but he's gloved it ... or rather, it hit him outside off.
Bravo stays deep in his crease to force the ball away on the off side.
turned into the leg side, and straight to the fielder.
played with the spin once again, this time he picks the gap.
looped down very wide outside off, Bravo slashes hard but top edges the stroke, which is stopped at short third man.
swiped into the leg side, where there's a man at deep mid-on who keeps them to a single.
good start, some drift outside off and the drive goes to extra cover.
bowled flat and fast outside off, and really full. Russell swings, but the ball scoots under his bat and is stopped by Taylor.

a maiden international wicket for Mushangwe! And it's come off a full toss. To be fair, it was low and dipping, and so Russell couldn't get underneath it to loft the stroke, and so his drive flew in the air towards Chakabva, who leapt forward to hold a sharp catch.
driven to mid-off, "no run," says Taylor, and he isn't lying.
driven to mid-off once again, and another dot.
a little shorter, and flat through the air, the elder Bravo nudging straight to point.
Utseya comes round the wicket to the younger Bravo, who turns a low full toss into the leg side.

dropped by Taylor! Dwayne was looking to angle the ball to third man, and it went on with the arm, running off the face of the bat. There was quite a deflection, so it wasn't the easiest chance, but a good keeper has got to hold those.
flicked with the spin into the leg side, finding the fielder.
Bravo stays back to punch through cover, and he's off the mark.
Darren Bravo stays very deep in his crease, and cuts towards cover point.
another attempted cut, but this time there's some turn and bounce and the ball fizzes past the bat.
full and straight, Dwayne Bravo rolling his wrists over the ball to work a single into the leg side.
Mpofu comes round the wicket to the left-hander, who pushes an offcutter to point.

fifty for Darren Bravo! He's chaperoned to the mark by Mpofu, who dishes up a short ball down the leg side with fine leg up in the circle. Bravo shuffles and sends a paddled pull down in that direction, collecting four.
a one-handed slash into the off side results in a single.
full and straight, driven back towards the bowler who can't quite get down to it. Just the single.
cracked into the off side, two runs taken.
driven straight back to the bowler, who collects cleanly.
turned with the spin into the leg side.
looped up outside off, Darren Bravo leaves alone.
evasive action from the bowler! Bravo bludgeoned a drive straight down the ground, and hit it so hard that Utseya's thoughts were of self-preservation. Four runs.
short and quite wide, spinning further away. Bravo slashes a cut, but just the one run out to the cover sweeper.
driven to long off for one.
a low full toss is biffed down the ground.
Jarvis clearly has a plan for Darren Bravo. He's bowled a series of shorter deliveries at him, mostly offcutters. This one is no different, and Bravo pulls to square leg with no great power.
another slower one, another dipping full toss. Bravo leaps out at it and fetches the ball down to long on.

another short one, and a quick one at 136.1kph, but this time Darren Bravo was waiting for it and spanks a pull in the air out to deep square leg ... there's a fielder there, but he runs in too far, and the ball flies over him and goes for six! There's a slow-mo replay of Jarvis after that effort, and it's easy to lipread what he thought of it. Waller the guilty party.
hammered out into the deep, and they rush back for the second.
taken on the full, and Darren Bravo finds a single to keep the strike.
very full and very wide, Darren Bravo stretches out to square drive.
Dwayne Bravo was aiming to hit this one out to the proverbial 'Row M', but lost all shape in the shot.

another huge slash, this time one-handed, and it's edged towards Utseya at short third man ... but he drops it! It was a tough chance, dipping in front of him, but it reached him and should have been taken. Nothing going Zimbabwe's way today.
flashed away for a single
ouch! Dwayne Bravo drives to Mushangwe at mid-off, and he hurls a powerful throw at the non-striker's end. Mpofu is behind the stumps, and it hits him flush on the knee. He can see the funny side ...
full, and dug out to end the over.
Dwayne Bravo is having an almighty heave at absolutely everything, but it's not quite coming off for him. This ragged off drive is aimed straight at the fielder.

Jarvis strikes, but Dwayne Bravo always looked like doing something like this. Jarvis delivered a slower one, on a length, and Bravo swung like he was trying to jump-start the Large Hadron Collider. A swirling top-edge was easily pouched by Chakabva at long off, and Zimbabwe finally have some joy.
a slightly short slower offcutter, and Bravo cuts out to the man at cover point.

scorched down the ground! Chakabva put in a diving effort, and got a hand to it, but couldn't stop this powerful stroke. In fact, it's hit so hard that Bravo has cracked his bat. It was, it appears, his favourite, and he has a hissy-fit upon noticing the crack, flinging his bat to the ground. Toys thrown.
quick, short and rising past Bravo's cutting bat. A new one.
and another dot ball to finish, as Bravo is unable to pick the gap with this bat, his second favourite.
Sarwan inside edges a Mpofu offcutter, but the ball bobbles off the pad and rolls behind point. They take a single, and he's off the mark in international cricket after his lengthy hiatus.
quicker through the air, and Bravo fetches a full ball into the leg side.
a hint of width offered outside off, and Sarwan runs the ball off the face of the bat down to third man.

Darren Bravo is channeling his inner Lara with this stroke. The high backlift, the full swing with the weight on the back foot, are both there. And so, too, is the timing, the ball sailing well over long on for six.
and another! That's a monstrous hit. Bravo set himself, waiting for the slow offcutter, and heaves it miles over midwicket. He's reached his highest score in one-day cricket.
a single ends the over, and Mpofu finishes with the rather hideous figures of 2 for 83 in ten overs.
heaved away to leg, two more to the total. Bravo is going for everything with just one over remaining.
Bravo misreads a the slower ball, sending a top edge swirling high into the air ... but it lands safely! They've taken the single. Can Sarwan get Bravo back on strike?

a paddle-pull flies over a leaping fielder at short fine leg, and goes for four. It was the quicker bouncer from Jarvis. Had it been the slower one, that probably would've landed in the fielder's lap.
yes, he gets the single! Nudged away, and they charge through to get Bravo on strike. He's got two deliveries remaining, and five runs to get for a maiden hundred.
clubbed to midwicket! He hit the covers off this slower one, an offcutter. The fielders barely moved.
a hundred for Darren Bravo! Jarvis sends down a very, very slow bouncer to end the innings. Bravo waits and waits, and eventually paddles it to the leg side for a the required single.

inn2.comm: Roach is on target to start, angling the ball in through the air and further off the track to hurry Sibanda's defense.
a little wider this time, and Sibanda raises his hands to leave the ball alone. Great pace and carry through to Ramdin.
short, fast and rising towards Sibanda's armpit. He raises his front leg and swivels into a pull, getting off the mark with a single to fine leg.
Chibhabha is neither forward nor back to his first delivery as Roach hits a probing length. But his bat is straight and true as he defends.
Roach charges in and pushes this one wider, Chibhabha shouldering arms.
fierce pace from Roach, above 140kph, and Chibhabha splices a defensive stroke to leg.
he fires down a full toss to start, and it's clipped softly to gully.
a tip-and-run single, Sibanda tapping the ball to point and being called through.
Chibhabha didn't know a lot about this one, thrusting forward in defense at a really quick one. The ball comes off the inside edge, and rolls to fine leg.
shot! This wasn't all that short from Best, but Sibanda was quickly onto the back foot and smeared a pull shot to the deep midwicket boundary. That pinged right out of the middle.
another good stroke, Best pitching the ball up to the bat this time and Sibanda driving the ball back to him.
Best is simply too quick for Sibanda with the final delivery, striking him under the arm as he shapes to pull.
a good stroke for no runs. Chibhabha's feet are moving now, and he steps forward to drive Roach to cover.
even better! Again Roach is full, but this time Chamu's drive threads the cover field and runs away for four. Not a great deal of flourish to it, but well timed and placed.
the bowler readjusts his length, keeping the batsman in the crease and defensive.
fuller from Roach, and Chibhabha leans into an off drive that finds the fielder.

another firm shot to a searingly quick delivery. Roach aimed this one at middle stump, but the angle meant a shot to leg was on. Chamu clipped, timed the shot, but Andre Russell pulled off a fine stop at midwicket.
punched back to the bowler.
another good shot finds the field. Not the greatest delivery from Best, a leg-stump half volley, but it's flicked straight at the fielder.
effort ball from Best, and Sibanda's defensive poke is hurried.
shot! Sibanda loves the pull. Sometimes, that gets him into trouble, but when it comes off it looks magnificent. This one pinged right out of the middle, the ball sailing over midwicket for six.
Best follows that up by targeting the stumps with a full delivery, Sibanda digging it out to mid-on. There's not a lot of sideways movement on offer out there.
on a fullish length once again, and Sibanda is firm in defense.
ah, now there is some seam movement! This jags in off the seam, and strikes Sibanda high on the pad. There's a muted appeal, but that was going over the top.
full, straight, and angling in towards the stumps. Chamu defends.
yet more defense from Chibhabha. He looks solid.
angling towards leg stump, and Chibhabha gets across the stumps to flick a single to fine leg.

gone! Roach spears one in to Sibanda's pads, and he misses with an attempted flick to leg. The umpire's finger goes up, and they choose not to refer it ... but what's this? Replays show that it would have missed leg stump! Sibanda conferred with Chibhabha about taking the review, but they decided against it. Oh dear ...
four byes! Masakadza did well to keep the bat inside the line, but he wasn't entirely sure whether to play or leave this. In the end he did neither, and Ramdin couldn't take it cleanly.
cut to point for no run, and that's the over.
tossed up on off stump, blocked
spins in sharply from a good length outside off, punched to cover

appeal for a catch at short leg, umpire's finger doesn't go up, but batsman is walking, Narine's needed three deliveries, half-forward, trying to nudge a spinning offbreak with the turn, inside edge on to pad, and balloons to the right of forward short leg, who takes it happily
offspinner played out to the off side
and he tries a reverse sweep now, full outside off, hit straight to point
this bites in from just outside off, he nudges it past the short leg
lifting from just back of a length, but Roach's angle allows it to be pushed wide of midwicket for one
that hits the bat hard from a good length, Taylor on the forward defensive, dead-bats it
into the pads at 138 kph from wide of the crease, tucked away neatly, but finds square leg
pushing forward, to a pitched up delivery and defends it from the high part of the bat, takes a hand off it
punched firmly off the front foot but there is a man in the way at short cover
fuller, around the off stump he pushes it out to short midwicket
almost carried to deep square leg, Masakadza bending down for the big slog sweep, with the turn, got it too square
reaches out outside off stump, and in the end decided to bail out of whatever he had thought of attempting, taps the offspinner away
reverse sweep, second time he's attempted it against Narine, cannot connect this time, hit on the pad well outside of
swept well, swept past short fine and beats deep square leg, got just enough outside the line to place the stroke
this one straightens on the stumps, Taylor handles it well, goes back and defends
blocked down the pitch off the front foot
loose, quite loose, has a go at the drive to a length ball outside, absolutely glued to the crease, and beaten
pitched up, and forced through the covers this time, for a couple
full and on the stumps from wide of the crease, a firm push from Masakadza, but straight to the bowler
lunges forward to defend the length ball, manages a thick inside edge down the pitch
crouches forward and pushes a good length ball back to the bowler
139.3 kph fullish delivery played out to mid on
and he brings out the reverse sweep once again, this time fetches it from leg stump and sends it behind point

what an acrobatic take from Roach at long on, it was shortish from Narine, but it was the straighter one, Masakadza had set himself up for the pull, and went ahead with the stroke, but ended up hitting it too straight and too much in the air, Roach came steaming in to his left, dived and was parallel to the ground when he took the ball, outstanding
full and flicked right into forward short leg
straighter one bounces and beats the edge as batsman pushes from the crease
swept from outside off, bounces just wide of short fine leg, deep square gets around
pushes forward in defence outside off
bowls it full and fast on off stump and Taylor smothers it in forward defence
good length, worked to square leg off the hip
goes after a full and widish one, mishits it over point
that was 140.4 kph and took from a short length, it also reared in at Taylor, who somehow managed not to edge it
and another one goes, after that short ball, Best follows it up with a full one, Taylor goes after it, and tamely spoons it to mid off, Zimbabwe falling apart
fast, furious, nippy Tino troubles him first ball with a good length delivery outside off, defended very awkwardly
straightens from round the stumps, left alone outside off, three men wait close
and one of them almost takes it, tossed up, there for the drive, he goes after it, thick edge just eludes second slip
paddled from far outside off stump, no one at fine leg, and that will be a boundary
flighted full toss hit hard but straight to mid off
that straightened from off and middle, defended
flat and quick, almost 94 kph, cut deftly behind point, Deonarine runs after it, and stops it with his foot just inside the rope
back of a length, 143 kph, brought down onto the pitch, Tino picks it up
good length delivery angled across just outside off, runs it to point who dives to stop it
left alone outside off
pitched up for the stumps now, defended tightly to covers
flashes at a 141 kph short and wide one, in the air but safe down to third man
bat away from body as he goes forward to defend, manages a thick inside edge to pad
bowls it full from round the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
comes down the track, takes it on the pad and pushes it away to the off side
that spun in sharply, but was not full, and he could back to slap it through covers
straight, flat and quick outside off, beats him on the cut
tries a sweep to a good length delivery that bounces over the bat, hits him and rolls away
defended off the front foot, not a bad first over from Deonarine
very low full toss outside off squeezed out to point
width for the cut and he plays the shot, but point is in the way
around the blockhole outside off from Tino now, dug out towards mid off
gets on the toes and opens the face to run a back of a length ball to point
tight line now from Tino, on off stump, just short of a length, he guides it to point again
lovely, good length, leaving him enough to beat the outside edge as he pushes forward
driven to cover, where the fielder fumbles the stop
tapped to cover, this time in the gap and there's time for a single.
chopped down behind square for a single.
attempted sweep as the ball goes down the leg side, it clips pad and Ramdin's take means there's no leg bye.
a tip-and-run single to the covers
nudged to leg, and another quick single ends the over.
pushed full and very wide across Ervine, who lets it go. That must've been close to being called wide.
Ervine stretches out with an angled bat to send the ball down to third man
a slower ball from Bravo, the offcutter, and Waller picks it to place a single into the off side
shot across the left-hander's bows once again. There's a booming drive, but no connection.
this time he does connect with the drive, sending the ball bouncing out to wide long-off with a firm stroke. The timing's not quite there, however, and it's easily stopped before the rope.
cutting in off the pitch, and Waller pokes forward in defense.
there's an extended appeal for lbw as Deonarine rushes one on with the arm, beating Ervine's messy cut and striking him on the pad. That actually looked quite close, but there was a big inside edge.
the riposte from the batsman is immediate and emphatic, Ervine bending into a slog sweep to pick up four to deep midwicket
quicker one, pushed back to the bowler
there's some width on offer, but Ervine's cut hits the field.
this time the left-hander presses forward in defense to a flighted offspinner that grips and turns a little.
shot! Ervine switches his hands round into a Flower-esque reverse sweep, threading the gap.
he starts with a slightly slower one outside off, Waller stepping well forward in defense.
an odd little shot from Waller, setting himself for a paddle as Bravo fires one down the leg side. That's called wide.
another slower one. This time Waller waits on the shot and turns the ball to midwicket.
pushed to cover, where the ball finds something of a gap and a quick single is taken.
pushed wide across Ervine, another one in the extras column.
full and wide again, Ervine drives, but plays-and-misses. Hands on the head for Bravo.
this time he does lay bat on it, the ball rolling into the off side for a single.
another slower ball, cutting in off the pitch to test Waller's patience and defense.
Deonarine loops one down the leg side, and all Ervine has to do is lay bat on it to collect three runs.
tossed up to the right-hander, who pokes at it on the front foot.
this time he finds a single to cover.
Ervine skips out and flicks to leg. Short fine leg comes round to cut the shot off.

Waller stays back to drive to cover ... the ball goes to the right of the fielder, and there's total confusion in the Zimbabwean running! Yes, no, yes, no ... either man could have been run out, but somehow they scramble home safely.
and a dot to finish.
quicker one from Bravo, luring Ervine into the drive.
again Ervine drives, but this time he goes squarer and threads a gap in the infield. The cover sweeper cleans up.
Waller shuffles across his stumps to one aimed at middle and leg, glancing for a single.
Bravo is quite happy to keep offering Ervine room to drive outside off, particularly if he keeps pinging the fielder.
predictably, it's full and wide from Bravo. Ervine drives out into the deep, the required rate nearing 9 an over.

a slower ball, and it almost creeps under the bat! In fact, Waller was aiming to sweep it, but bottom edged the ball into the ground. It hit the turf and bounced up and over middle stump. Amazing! Waller smiles at his good fortune, despite the dire situation of his team.
punched back to the bowler.
another freebie, speared down the leg side and they take a run as the ball rushes past Ramdin.
Waller goes back to work the ball into the leg side, but there's no single to be had.
short, a long hop really, and Waller pulls it in the air, but with no great conviction. Just the one.
there's a shot! Ervine sweeps, and the ball appeared to come off the top edge, but sailed all the way over deep square. Zimbabwe could do with a little more of the same from Waller.
Ervine stretches forward in defense.
again Ervine is well forward, but this time he pushes the ball into a gap
flung way, way down the off side across Ervine.
closer to the stumps this time, and Ervine angles his bat to pick up a single on the off side
a defensive push and run from Waller. He's played that combo a few times already.
again Ervine angles the bat, but this time he finds a fielder at cover point.
chipped just past the bowler! Bravo pitched it right up to Ervine, who was too early into the shot and drove it in the air ... but over the leaping bowler.
a slower ball from Bravo, perhaps the back-of-the-hand variety. It's very full and Waller has to dig it out.
and another dot ball to end the over, Waller quite happy to defend.
Russell hits a good length to the left-hander, angling the ball across Ervine, who is rooted at the crease and beaten outside off.
just short of a good length, and Ervine stands up to punch to cover.
a similar delivery and shot, but this time Ervine places it a little wider of the fielder and they rush through for one.
full and straight. Waller walks across to off and nurdles a single to leg.

and, as if on cue, Russell strikes! It was an innocuous delivery, full outside off. What Russell did have, however, was a man at short extra cover, and Ervine's loose drive went straight to him. So ends a 58-run partnership.

Chakabva is greeted to the crease with a bouncer, which he ducks under easily enough. He scored his 40-odd in the warm-up at a strike rate of close to 200, and Zimbabwe need something similar now. Whether that actually happens, of course ...
full, and angling in towards off stump. Waller gets forward to push the ball to point.
an almost identical ball and stroke, the point fielder in action once again to stop a defensive push.
edged through the vacant slip area! A man had just been moved out of that position! Roach got this one to hold its line outside off and Waller played inside it, edging it cleanly past Ramdin.
on a length and straight, this time Waller's defense is firm.
tapped down close to the wicket, and they sprint through for one.
Chakabva holds his bat inside the line as this one leaves him off the pitch and goes past the outside edge.
Russell continues, and there's a distinctly Taibu-esque aura to Chakabva's stance as he gets back and across to defend. He looks busy at the crease.
just short of a length and straight once again. Chakabva is back and across in defense.
now, this one lands a little too straight and Chakabva nudges it off the hip for a single.
fuller, landing on a middle and leg line and Waller turns it to midwicket.
Russell over-steps, and a free hit is coming up. Perhaps that'll stoke Waller's fire?
Russell flings the free hit full and wide, and Waller lances a drive out to deep point.
flicked into the leg side, Russell's delivery landing on middle and leg and holding its line.
rising on the diminutive Chakabva, who works it into the leg side.
wider of off stump, and Chakabva leaves it well alone.
short and wide once again, but Chakabva won't be tempted into a drive.
straighter this time, and Chakabva has to play at it. His defense holds firm.
on a length, not a shot in sight as Chakabva gets across to defend.
and yet more defense to end the over. It's solid, but a little pointless in this situation.
he starts with a regular offspinner that is tapped into the off side.
another offspinner, this one grips and turns quite sharply but Chakabva works with the spin to find a single behind square.
thrashed through cover! Finally a shot in anger from Waller. Narine offered him width and flight, and he stretched into a fluid, well-timed drive.
he follows that up with the front of the hand delivery, pushed through quicker, but it's read and popped into the off side for a quick single.
quicker still through the air, Chakabva watches it like a hawk and defends.
solid defense again to end the over. Apart from the boundary in this over, Zimbabwe's scoring rate is flatlining.
Waller is playing some shots now! This was a dismissive short-arm jab to a short delivery, the ball bouncing away to midwicket.
phew, that is some follow-up from Russell! The previous delivery was bowled at quite a gentle pace, but this one is much quicker and it's almost sconned the batsman, who ends up on the turf.
fuller and straighter. Waller nurdles a single into the leg side.
a good looking shot for no runs. Chakabva walks into a loose-wristed punch, the ball being stopped at point.
a short, rising delivery, but Chakabva gets right across and rides the bounce to find a single to fine leg.
Waller angles the bat, playing with soft hands, but the ball bounces down and is stopped at slip.
not picked by Chakabva, the ball holding its line to burst past the outside edge.
a more orthodox offspinner, though quite quick and flat through the air. Chakabva opts to play back in defense.

Chakabva attempts to break free with a wild swipe, aiming down the ground, but he's crease bound and not to the pitch of the delivery. He slices under the ball, and it balloons up and over cover to be easily caught by Roach. A much easier chance than his last one!
Waller is back and across to defend after the wicket, the batsmen having crossed.
this grips and spins away from Waller's bat, but he follows it to defend.
and decent backfoot defense ends the over.
a bouncer, but it rises well over the batsman's ducking head.
moving across the right hander again, this time he manages to defend
floats it full across him from round the stumps, straightens outside off, blocked
Best quick and on a good length on the stumps, he's nudged out to square leg
plays out one outside off to point now
Utseya pushes forward in defense once more.
pushed too far down the leg side, that'll be wide.
a well-judged single is taken. Quick call from Utseya.
fast and on a length, Waller gets across and nudges a single behind square on the leg side.
Utseya gets half forward to have a drive at the final delivery, which is pitched up the bat outside off. It's, perhaps, just a little too quick for him, ball hitting bat.
Narine continues round the wicket to Waller, who sweeps to short fine leg.
back over the wicket now, Waller punches to cover and immediately calls for one.
pushed to cover point, and they take another single.
Waller presses forward, angling the bat to work the ball to point.
not picked. Not even close. Waller hangs his bat out at one that leaves him off the pitch. He's lucky not to edge that.
this time he does lay bat on ball, guiding it down to gully.
Best hurries Utseya's defensive poke, taking the inside edge.
short, sharp and rising. Utseya fends to leg.
Best offers a little width outside off, and Utseya steps back to punch to point.
a slower ball this time, fuller and wider of off stump. Utseya spots it, and runs a single down to third man.
Waller comes forward to drive, the ball making a resounding crack as it hits bat. Stopped at point.
full once more to end the over, and again there's a load crack as ball hits bat. Waller's checking the end of his bat as he confers with Utseya at the end of the over.
spinning in off the track, tucked to leg.
looped through the air, holding its line. Utseya defends.
flicked to short fine leg this time, straight to the fielder.
pushed through quite flat, not much deviation off the track and Utseya defends.
pushed through with the arm once again, and more defense.
slower through the air, and the ball grips and spins towards the stumps as Utseya gets right across to off.
Best begins his over with a no-ball, and a free hit will now be offered to Utseya. If he spanks this next one out of the ground, drinks on me. Forever.
oh dear, that's another no-ball from Best, but this time because of the height. He slung down a very high full toss that Utseya flapped out to midwicket for a couple.
sliced very high up in the air, off the free hit, and Ramdin holds the catch - but there's no dismissal of course, just a single.
that's quick from Best, and full too. Waller digs him out into the off side, and they take one.
hurled down the leg side by Best, a clear wide.
much straighter, and nicely full too. Utseya has to jab the bat quickly down in defense.
on a length this time, and Utseya hops into a defensive pose.
quicker still from Best, nudging 140kph. It's not his quickest, to be sure, but it's enough to rattle Utseya's bat.
and Utseya is solidly behind the ball to end the over.
a drive from Waller, but it comes off the inner half of the bat and goes back to the bowler.
spinning in once again, played with soft hands.
a little wider of off, and Waller runs a single down behind square.
the ball holds its line on off stump, but Utseya is behind it to defend.
and he's almost in action straight away, as Utseya pushes forward in defense but can't quite control the stroke. But the ball goes safely to ground.
and yet more doughty defense to end the over. A modest 17 runs an over needed by Zimbabwe.
shot! Waller greets the stand-in captain's return to action with a thumping cover drive.

back-to-back boundaries, as Waller flicks a leg-stump half volley to the square leg boundary. There are West Indians in the crowd standing and applauding the shot, that's how badly Zimbabwe have played.
a quicker one from Bravo to follow up those two slower cutters, and Waller defends it.
turned into the leg side, and they amble through for one.
Utseya stretches forward this time, as Bravo lures him into a defensive push outside off. The ball goes straight to gully.
the batsman is back and across in defense to end the over. "Good Test match batting from Utseya," says Ian Bishop. I wonder if he's read some of the comments in this commentary?
a loosener from Russell, and it's flashed to the cover point boundary by Waller. Good bat-speed from him there, and plenty of power in the stroke. He's closing in on a half-century.
more of an effort ball from Russell, and it zips past Waller's outside edge.
this one keeps a little low, Waller was back in defense and had to jab at the ball.
and now he finds a single, dropping the ball into the off side.
just short of a good length, and Utseya rolls his wrists over the ball to send it bouncing through square leg.
chopped down to third man, and Waller gets the single he needs to take him to fifty. It's been a decent knock, allowing Zimbabwe a modicum of honour in an otherwise shoddy performance.
speared down the leg side by Bravo. The ball clips Waller's pad on the way through, and runs away for four.
straighter this time, and a slower ball too. Dug out towards the bowler, who pulls off an athletic stop in his follow through.
driven through mid-off for a single.
pushed down the leg side once more by Bravo. There's a strangle appeal, though I'm not sure for what. A clear wide.
a slower ball, outside off, and Utseya plays it down towards gully.
the quicker one from Bravo, and Utseya nudges it away for a single on the off side.
gone! Waller reaches the fifty and falls soon afterwards. Bravo floated a much, much slower one right up to the bat and Waller took the bait, driving straight to the man at extra cover.
short and wide from Russell, and Utseya cuts it out to deep point.
a bouncer from Russell, dug in short but at no great pace. Jarvis is easily under it.
he follows that up with an attempted yorker, which slips out as a low full toss. Pushed to mid-on.
on a length outside off, and Jarvis plays no stroke.
another bouncer, and this is a better one. Jarvis almost ends up on his rump as he ducks underneath the ball.
yet another short one, and Jarvis bends his knees to avoid it.
punched firmly away by Utseya, and they take the single.
full on off stump, the ball flies off the edge and goes down towards third man.
a low full toss is chipped down the ground to long on.
pitched right up to the bat on off stump. Jarvis appears to attempt ... some sort of slog sweep. In any case, he gets nothing on it, swiping at fresh air.
outside off once more, and it's left alone.
full and on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler.
Utseya works a length delivery to midwicket.
Russell aims a little wider off of stump, and Utseya taps it to point.
pushed through point once more, this time they find space for a single.

Jarvis is flummoxed by a slower one, playing way too early, and has his off stump rattled. He didn't know too much about that. There's a muted celebration from the bowler, but West Indies are just going through the motions now.
a length delivery to start, and Mushangwe defends. A case of ball hitting bat, perhaps.
the Zimbabwe no. 10 ducks under a bouncerto end the over.
a short ball is paddle-pulled over the man at short fine leg with no great power, the batsmen taking a single.
again, ball hits bat as a very quick one from Best jags in at Mushangwe.
where on earth did that come from? Mushangwe backs away and scythes a cut up and over point, the ball carrying all the way for six. Viru himself would've been proud of that shot.
again Mushangwe backs away, but this time Best follows him with a low, dipping full toss that he can't put away.
Mushangwe makes room once more, but again Best spots him and follows him with a length delivery. Fended into the leg side.
poking defense helps Mushangwe see out the over.
Utseya stands at the crease and nudges a length delivery to point.
straighter from Russell, on a length once more. Utseya's feet don't move much as he defends from the crease.
turned through square leg for a single.
Mushangwe shuffles in the crease and jabs at the ball, to little effect.
rising up at the batsman once again, who plays to gully.
and backfoot defense ends the over.
on a length and straight, Utseya pushes the ball into the off side.
flung down the leg side, a clear wide.
a slower ball from Best. Utseya pushes it towards mid-on, and they take a single as the fielder is a little deep.
Mushangwe backs away and flays a drive out to deep cover. Good shot for one run.
full and straight, Utseya propping forward to push at the ball.
full once again, poked into the covers.
and another dot ball ends the over. Don't worry, it's almost over now.
turned into the leg side, playing with the spin.
chopped down on the off side for a single.
nudged to midwicket, no run taken.
again into the leg side, but this time into space and there's one run on offer.
bosh! Mushangwe is going to have some fun while he's out there, bending into a slog sweep to send the ball way over long on. Barely a murmur from the crowd.
speared in at off stump, Mushangwe defends.
a slower one, Utseya plays it to point and inquires about the possibility of a single. Not on.
outside off once again, tapped straight to the fielder.
a very slow slower ball, the offcutter, and Utseya guides it down past gully for a single.
another slower one, Mushangwe picks it and keeps it out.
Mushangwe's entertaining innings comes to an end, a quicker ball rushing onto him, taking the inside edge and cannoning into the stumps.
Mpofu survives the final delivery, just about, and Zimbabwe have just one more over to struggle through.
Utseya is utterly solid in defense.
Deonarine rushes back to his mark to deliver another ball, Utseya offering a dead bat in return.
yet more defense. Limpet-like, Utseya is.
"Ye shall not pass!" screams Utseya's perpendicular defensive bat.
A flat, fast delivery from Deonarine, and Utseya defends once more. Just the one delivery to go.
and there we have it, Utseya taps the final delivery away in defense to end the game.
